shortdesc.$: Please read the safety information to ensure that you use the appliance safely.
You can find general information for this instruction manual here.

p.$: Read this instruction manual carefully. Only this will ensure you use the appliance safely and efficiently.
This manual is intended for the user of the appliance.
Follow the safety instructions and warnings.
Keep the instruction manual and the product information safe for future reference or for the next owner.
Check the appliance after unpacking it. Do not connect the appliance if it has been damaged in transit.

shortdesc.$: Read the information on intended use to ensure that you use the appliance correctly and safely.

li.@title: li - Use in accordance with UI

p.$: As specified in this instruction manual.
In private households and in enclosed spaces in a domestic environment.

BSHCollectionOfElements.$: Up to an altitude of max.

shortdesc.$: Avoid risks to children and vulnerable persons.

p.$: This appliance may be used by children aged 8 or over and by people who have reduced physical, sensory or mental abilities or inadequate experience and/or knowledge, provided that they are supervised or have been instructed on how to use the appliance safely and have understood the resulting dangers.
Children must not play with the appliance.

p.@title: p - Cleaning/user maintenance without age specification
p.$: Cleaning and user maintenance must not be performed by children unless they are being supervised.
Keep children under the age of 8 years away from the appliance and power cable.

shortdesc.$: Follow these safety instructions when installing the appliance.

cause.$: Improper installation may cause injury.

safety-instruction.$: When installing and connecting the appliance, follow the instructions in the manual and installation instructions.

cause.$: Improper installation is dangerous.

safety-instruction.$: Connect and operate the appliance only in accordance with the specifications on the rating plate.
Connect the appliance to a power supply with alternating current only via a properly installed socket with earthing.
The protective conductor system of the domestic electrical installation must be properly installed.
Never equip the appliance with an external switching device, e.g. a timer or remote control.

When the appliance is installed, the mains plug of the power cord must be freely accessible. If free access is not possible, an all-pole isolating switch must be installed in the permanent electrical installation according to the installation regulations.
When installing the appliance, check that the power cable is not trapped or damaged.

cause.$: Cutting through the supply hose or immersing the Aqua-Stop valve in water is dangerous.

safety-instruction.$: Never immerse the plastic housing in water. The plastic housing on the supply hose contains an electric valve.
Never cut through the supply hose. The supply hose contains electric power cables.

cause.$: It is dangerous to use an extended power cord and non-approved adapters.

safety-instruction.$: Do not use extension cables or multiple socket strips.
If the power cord is too short, contact Customer Service.
Only use adapters approved by the manufacturer.

cause.$: If the appliance is not installed properly, this may result in burns.

safety-instruction.$: With free-standing appliances, ensure that they are installed with the back panel against a wall.

link.@source: safety_Risk of electrical shock_Protective grounding Denmark

shortdesc.$: Follow these safety instructions when using the appliance.

cause.$: Failure to comply with safety instructions and directions for use on packagings of detergent and rinse aid products may cause serious harm to health.

safety-instruction.$: Follow the safety instructions and directions for use on the packagings of detergent and rinse aid products.

cause.$: Adding solvents to the interior of the appliance may cause explosions.

safety-instruction.$: Never add solvents to the interior of the appliance.

cause.$: Highly caustic alkaline or highly acidic cleaning agents in conjunction with aluminium parts in the interior of the appliance may cause explosions.

safety-instruction.$: Never use highly caustic alkaline or highly acidic cleaning agents, in particular commercial or industrial products, in conjunction with aluminium parts (e.g. grease filters of extractor hoods or aluminium pans), e.g. for the Machine Care programme.

cause.$: Leaving the appliance door open may result in injury.

safety-instruction.$: Only open the appliance door to load or unload tableware in order to prevent accidents, e.g. through tripping.
Do not sit or stand on the appliance door when open.

cause.$: Knives and utensils with sharp points can cause injuries.

safety-instruction.$: Arrange knives and utensils with sharp points in the cutlery basket with the points downwards, on the knife shelf or in the cutlery drawer.

cause.$: If you open the appliance door while the programme is running, hot water may splash out of the appliance.

safety-instruction.$: Open the appliance door carefully if the programme is still running.

cause.$: Overfilling the Baskets may cause the appliance to tip up.

safety-instruction.$: Never overfill the Baskets with free-standing appliances.

safety.@title: Risk of electric shock - Moisture penetration

cause.$: An ingress of moisture can cause an electric shock.

safety-instruction.$: Only use the appliance in enclosed spaces.
Never expose the appliance to intense heat or humidity.
Do not use steam- or high-pressure cleaners to clean the appliance.

cause.$: If the insulation of the power cord is damaged, this is dangerous.

safety-instruction.$: Never let the power cord come into contact with hot appliance parts or heat sources.
Never let the power cord come into contact with sharp points or edges.
Never kink, crush or modify the power cord.

cause.$: The blow opening of the Zeolith container becomes hot and can cause burns.

safety-instruction.$: Never touch the blow opening of the Zeolith container.

link.@source: Risk of electric shock - Moisture penetration
Risk of electric shock - Moisture penetration
Risk of electric shock - Moisture penetration

shortdesc.$: Follow the safety instructions if the appliance is damaged.

cause.$: If the appliance or the power cord is damaged, this is dangerous.

safety-instruction.$: Never operate a damaged appliance.
Never operate an appliance with a cracked or fractured surface.
Never pull on the power cord to unplug the appliance. Always unplug the appliance at the mains.
If the appliance or the power cord is damaged, immediately unplug the power cord or switch off the fuse in the fuse box and turn off the water tap.
Repairs to the appliance should only be carried out by trained specialist staff.

cause.$: Incorrect repairs are dangerous.

safety-instruction.$: Repairs to the appliance should only be carried out by trained specialist staff.
Only use genuine spare parts when repairing the appliance.
If the power cord of this appliance is damaged, it must be replaced with a special connection cable, which is available from the manufacturer or his Customer Service.

shortdesc.$: Follow the safety instructions if there are children in your home.

cause.$: Children may put packaging material over their heads or wrap themselves up in it and suffocate.

safety-instruction.$: Keep packaging material away from children.
Do not let children play with packaging material.

cause.$: Children may breathe in or swallow small parts, causing them to suffocate.

safety-instruction.$: Keep small parts away from children.
Do not let children play with small parts.

cause.$: Children may become trapped in the appliance and suffocate.

safety-instruction.$: Use the childproof lock if fitted.
Never let children play with or operate the appliance.

cause.$: Children can lock themselves in the appliance, thereby putting their lives at risk.

safety-instruction.$: With redundant appliances, unplug the power cord. Then cut through the cord and damage the lock on the appliance door beyond repair so that the appliance door will no longer close.

cause.$: With higher-level appliances, children can become crushed between the appliance door and cabinet doors underneath.

safety-instruction.$: Keep an eye on children when opening and closing the appliance door.

cause.$: Rinse aid and detergent may cause chemical burns to the mouth, throat and eyes.

safety-instruction.$: Keep children away from detergent and rinse aid products.
Keep children away from the appliance when open. The water in the interior of the dishwasher is not drinking water. It may contain residues of detergents and rinse aid.

cause.$: Children may get their fingers caught in the slots of the tablet collecting tray and injure themselves.

safety-instruction.$: Keep children away from the appliance when open.

shortdesc.$: Follow these instructions to prevent material damage to your appliance, accessories or other objects in your kitchen.
Follow the instructions when installing the appliance.

cause.$: Improper installation of the appliance may cause damage.

safety-instruction.$: If the dishwasher is installed above or below other domestic appliances, follow the information on installation in combination with a dishwasher in the installation instructions for the individual appliances.

If there is no information or if the installation instructions do not include the relevant information, contact the manufacturer of these appliances to check that the dishwasher can be installed above or below these appliances.
If no information is available from the manufacturer, the dishwasher should not be installed above or below such appliances.
To ensure the safe operation of all domestic appliances, continue following the installation instructions for the dishwasher.
Do not install the dishwasher under a hob.
Do not install the dishwasher near heat sources, e.g. radiators, heat storage tanks, ovens or other appliances that generate heat.

cause.$: Modified or damaged water hoses may result in material damage and damage to the appliance.

safety-instruction.$: Never kink, crush, modify or cut through water hoses.
Only use the water hoses supplied with the appliance or genuine spare hoses.
Never re-use water hoses that have been used before.

cause.$: If the water pressure is too high or too low, this may impair functioning of the appliance.

BSHCollectionOfElements.$: Make sure that the water pressure in the water supply system is min.

safety-instruction.$: If the water pressure exceeds the maximum value specified, a pressure-reducing valve must be installed between the drinking water connection and the hose set of the appliance.

shortdesc.$: Follow the instructions when using the appliance.

cause.$: Escaping water vapour can damage fitted units.

safety-instruction.$: When the programme ends, leave the appliance to cool down for a while before opening the door.

cause.$: Special salt can damage the tub due to corrosion.

safety-instruction.$: To make sure that any special salt that escapes is washed out of the tub, add the special salt to the dispenser for special salt immediately before the programme starts.

cause.$: Detergent may damage the water softening system.

safety-instruction.$: Only fill the dispenser of the water softening system with special dishwasher salt.

cause.$: Unsuitable cleaning agents may damage the appliance.

safety-instruction.$: Do not use a steam cleaner.
So as not to scratch the finish on the appliance, do not use sponges with a rough surface or abrasive cleaning agents.
To prevent corrosion, do not use sponge cloths on dishwashers with a stainless steel front or rinse such cloths thoroughly several times before using them for the first time.
